com.ti.debug.engine.scripting

Class TargetConfigurationGenerator

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.ti.debug.engine.scripting.TargetConfigurationGenerator

  • public class TargetConfigurationGenerator
extends java.lang.Object
    This class encapsulates the Target Configuration (setup) functionality. The server object can be used to create target configuration (ccxml) files for connecting to board/devices.

    Note that the default install directory is the targetDB folder of the default install path of CCS and the default user folder is the current directory as reported by the environment.

    // Create Environment, DebugServer and create a TargetConfigurationGenerator object
    ScriptingEnvironment env = new ScriptingEnvironment();
    DebugServer myServer = (DebugServer) env.getServer("DebugServer.1");
    TargetConfigurationGenerator configGenerator = myServer.createTargetConfigurationGenerator();

    // set targetDB and output folder
    configGenerator.setOutputDirectory("C:/Documents and Settings/All Users/user/CCSTargetConfigurations");

    // Connection
    configServer.printListOfConnections();
    configServer.setConnection("TI MSP430 USB1");

    // Boards
    configServer.printListOfBoards();
    configServer.setBoard("DSK5416");
    -----------OR------------
    // Devices
    configServer.printListOfDevices();
    configServer.setDevice("MSP430F2131");

    // Generate Configuration file
    configServer.createConfiguration("DSSTestConfiguration.ccxml");

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void createConfiguration(java.lang.String xmlName)
      Creates a CCXML configuration file with the given name in the user folder based on the Connection (via setConnection()) + Board/Device (via setBoard() or setDevice()) pair

      PreCondition:
      - setUserDirectory() needs to be called first if not using default directory
      - setConnection() needs to be called with valid connection
      - setDevice() or setBoard() needs to be called with valid device/board
      java.lang.String getBoardDevice()
      Get the name of the device/board that was set using one of the available Set APIs

    • Constructor Detail

      • TargetConfigurationGenerator

        public TargetConfigurationGenerator()

    • Method Detail

      • createConfiguration

        public void createConfiguration(java.lang.String xmlName)
                         throws ScriptingException
        Creates a CCXML configuration file with the given name in the user folder based on the Connection (via setConnection()) + Board/Device (via setBoard() or setDevice()) pair

        PreCondition:
        - setUserDirectory() needs to be called first if not using default directory
        - setConnection() needs to be called with valid connection
        - setDevice() or setBoard() needs to be called with valid device/board
        Parameters:
        xmlName - (String) - the name of the configuration file to create (ie; "DSSTestConfiguration.ccxml").
        Throws:
        ScriptingException - - a scripting exception is thrown if setConnection and (one of setBoard() or setDevice()) has not been called; or if there was an error creating the ccxml file.

      • getBoardDevice

        public java.lang.String getBoardDevice()
        Get the name of the device/board that was set using one of the available Set APIs
        Returns:
        (String) - the name of the device/board currently set, or null if setBoard() or setDevice() has not been called

      • getCombinedDeviceBoardsList

        public java.lang.String[] getCombinedDeviceBoardsList()
        Returns an String array containing the list of boards, devices, and configurations (in-order) in the install targetDB directory.
        This list will be filter on connectType if setConnection() was called beforehand.

        PreCondition:
        - setUserDirectory() needs to be called first if not using default directory

      • getConnection

        public java.lang.String getConnection()
        Get the name of the connection that was set
        Returns:
        (String) - the name of the connection currently set, or null if setConnection() has not been called

      • getListOfBoards

        public java.lang.String[] getListOfBoards()
        Returns an String array containing the list of boards in the install targetDB directory.
        This list will be filter on connectType if setConnection() was called beforehand.

        PreCondition:
        - setUserDirectory() needs to be called first if not using default directory
        See Also:
        setConnection(String)

      • getListOfConfigurations

        public java.lang.String[] getListOfConfigurations()
        Returns an String array containing the list of configurations in the install targetDB directory.
        This list will be filter on connectType if setConnection() was called beforehand.

        PreCondition:
        - setUserDirectory() needs to be called first if not using default directory

      • getListOfConnections

        public java.lang.String[] getListOfConnections()
        Returns an String array containing the list of connections in the install targetDB directory. If a device/board has been set, it will return a filter list of connections associated with the device/board.

        PreCondition:
        - setUserDirectory() needs to be called first if not using default directory

      • getListOfDevices

        public java.lang.String[] getListOfDevices()
        Returns an String array containing the list of devices in the install targetDB directory.
        This list will be filter on connectType if setConnection() was called beforehand.

        PreCondition:
        - setUserDirectory() needs to be called first if not using default directory

      • getOutputDirectory

        public java.lang.String getOutputDirectory()
        Get the directory use for storing generated CCXML files
        Returns:
        (String) - the full path to the user directoy

      • getTargetDBDirectory

        public java.lang.String getTargetDBDirectory()
        Get the current TargetDB directory. This directory is the one that will be used by DebugServer, which should correspond to the directory on the XPCOM runtime path, and cannot be change.
        Returns:
        (String) - the full path to the TargetDB directoy for CCS

      • printCombinedDeviceBoardsList

        public void printCombinedDeviceBoardsList()
        Prints the list of devices, boards and simulator configurations in the install targetDB directory.
        This list will be filter on connectType if setConnection() was called beforehand.

        PreCondition:
        - setUserDirectory() needs to be called first if not using default directory

      • printListOfBoards

        public void printListOfBoards()
        Prints the list of boards in the install targetDB directory.
        This list will be filter on connectType if setConnection() was called beforehand.

        PreCondition:
        - setUserDirectory() needs to be called first if not using default directory
        See Also:
        setConnection(String)

      • printListOfConfigurations

        public void printListOfConfigurations()
        Prints the list of configurations in the install targetDB directory.
        This list will be filter on connectType if setConnection() was called beforehand.

        PreCondition:
        - setUserDirectory() needs to be called first if not using default directory
        See Also:
        setConnection(String)

      • printListOfConnections

        public void printListOfConnections()
        Prints the list of connections in the install targetDB directory. If a device/board has been set, it will print a filter list of connections associated with the device/board.

        PreCondition:
        - setUserDirectory() needs to be called first if not using default directory

      • printListOfDevices

        public void printListOfDevices()
        Prints the list of devices in the install targetDB directory.
        This list will be filter on connectType if setConnection() was called beforehand.

        PreCondition:
        - setUserDirectory() needs to be called first if not using default directory

      • setBoard

        public void setBoard(java.lang.String boardStr)
              throws ScriptingException
        Set the board to use for the configuration, based on the board name

        PreCondition:
        - setUserDirectory() needs to be called first if not using default directory
        Parameters:
        boardStr - (String) - the name of the board to use
        Throws:
        ScriptingException - - a scripting exception is thrown if connectStr does not specify a valid board name

      • setBoardDevice

        public void setBoardDevice(java.lang.String setStr)
                    throws ScriptingException
        Set the device to use for the configuration, based on the device/board/configuration name
        This API can be used to replace setBoard(), setDevice() and setConfiguration() if you do not know which one to use, but note that this can take longer than complete.

        PreCondition:
        - setUserDirectory() needs to be called first if not using default directory
        Parameters:
        setStr - (String) - the name of the device/board/configuration to use
        Throws:
        ScriptingException - - a scripting exception is thrown if connectStr does not specify a valid device name

      • setConfiguration

        public void setConfiguration(java.lang.String configStr)
                      throws ScriptingException
        Set the configuration to use for the configuration, based on the device name

        PreCondition:
        - setUserDirectory() needs to be called first if not using default directory
        Parameters:
        configStr - (String) - the name of the device to use
        Throws:
        ScriptingException - - a scripting exception is thrown if connectStr does not specify a valid device name

      • setConnection

        public void setConnection(java.lang.String connectStr)
                   throws ScriptingException
        Set the connection to use for the configuration, based on connection name

        PreCondition:
        - setUserDirectory() needs to be called first if not using default directory
        Parameters:
        connectStr - (String) - the name of the connection to use
        Throws:
        ScriptingException - - a scripting exception is thrown if connectStr does not specify a valid connection name

      • setDevice

        public void setDevice(java.lang.String deviceStr)
               throws ScriptingException
        Set the device to use for the configuration, based on the device name

        PreCondition:
        - setUserDirectory() needs to be called first if not using default directory
        Parameters:
        deviceStr - (String) - the name of the device to use
        Throws:
        ScriptingException - - a scripting exception is thrown if connectStr does not specify a valid device name

      • setOutputDirectory

        public void setOutputDirectory(java.lang.String dir)
        Sets the directory used for storing the generated CCXML files
        Parameters:
        dir - (String) - the full path to the directory the user wants to store the generated CCXML files

      • unsetConnection

        public void unsetConnection()
        Clears the selected connection type. This allows for querying devices/boards for all connections again

      • unsetDeviceBoard

        public void unsetDeviceBoard()
        Clears the selected device/board. This allows for querying connection for all devices/boards again
